definition: the early Ming (i.e. from second half of 14th century)
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
at first/(at the) beginning/first/junior/basic
late Yuan and early Ming/mid 14th century

sentences.english: Li-Jia Institution enforced all over China at the beginning of Ming Dynasty originated in the south of the Yangtze River.
sentences.chinese: 明初在全国强制推行的里甲制度原创于江南地区。

sentences.english: Borneo (Brunei) was one of the countries with which China kept close friendly contact in the early Ming Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 明初浡泥是中国友好往来较为密切的海外国家之一。

sentences.english: Tibetan lamas began to live in the capital from Hongwu period of Ming Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 藏族喇嘛僧人留住京城始于明初洪武年间。

sentences.english: Extraoral origin of small-hing state, shortage of the early Ming Dynasty to the north superoxide deserter living Kawamura.
sentences.chinese: 祖籍口外小兴州，明初逃兵荒到北歧河村居住。

sentences.english: At the same time, it brought great influence on constituting Ming Dynasty law.
sentences.chinese: 这一结果对明初法律的制定也产生了重要影响。

sentences.english: Early Ming is a most important period in the development of southern drama.
sentences.chinese: 明初是南戏发展的一个重要时期。

sentences.english: In the early stage of the Ming Dynasty, the supervisor was closely related with Neo-Confucianism.
sentences.chinese: 明初的言官与理学有着密切联系。

sentences.english: In the early Ming period, the government school played the primary role, and the local schools were the assistance.
sentences.chinese: 明初，吉安府地方教育以官学为主，社学为辅。

sentences.english: Wei family moved to Dizhou in Shandong province from Zaoqiang in Hebei province at the beginning of Ming Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 惠民魏氏家族原籍河北枣强，明初迁至山东棣州。
